data: Confirm order for reinfusion of cell salvaged blood with team at surgical sign-out. Anesthesiologist to order
Reinfusion as management of significant blood loss at cesarean section.   Reinfusion in a patient clinically anticipated to be at risk of postoperative anemia

Collect Cord Blood Sample at Delivery and Place Order for Rh Testing
Collect cord blood sample at delivery and place order for “RBC Neonatal Investigation” in newborn chart

If: patient is eligible for RhIG (as per laboratory comment for maternal investigation), then order and, then administer: 1500 IU (300 ug), routine, IM, Administer over: Not appliable, Indications: Postpartum Rh Neg female w/Rh Pos Infant, T;N
If patient is Rh negative or unknown and newborn is Rh positive, perform Kleihauer Betke test. It is not necessary to wait for Kleihauer Betke test to be taken prior to administering RhIg
Condition Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when: patient is Rh negative or unknown and newborn is Rh positive Then: nurse to place Kleihauer Betke test
Notify Transfusion Medicine if patient has had Kleihauer Betke test and has had reinfusion of cell salvaged blood
If Kleihauer test positive, additional dose of Rh Immune Globulin may be required. Consider consult to transfusion medicine laboratory. Flow cytometry test may also be required
